messages.message: Is there a way to call the read file API and get back a JSON for an IBDOC instead of the protobuf?
The read-file API should not be doing that conversion.  You can use the parsedIbocr library to get the JSON though

```builder, err = ibocr.ParsedIBOCRBuilder.load_from_str(input_filepath, content)```
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1J1Y23uwHu3LGAXmQWhhS3gDnpeUBwn38a1cTWaKuqW4/edit#heading=h.8ghnsh4wav8y
But what if I am a customer using the API to get the file?
I dont have access to the ibocr library
(this is outside of Instabase)
can you explain the use case?
Hmm … :slightly_smiling_face: what exactly are you looking for?
I am looking to read the results of a Flow and feed that into some downstream system, but the results are IBDOCs
i typically convert the output to JSON in an apply udf step if a downstream system needs it
the only issue with that is the flow results api doesnt like output that isnt ibdoc
Hmmm alright… Like my main concern here is that we tell customers that IBDOC isnt a proprietary format and is open, but we don’t actually provide them the tools to do that haha
lets not tell customers that lol
@Aaron Vontell wait — we should not be telling customers that IBDOC is an open format
:joy:
we don’t say it is *open* just that it isn’t *proprietary*, amirite? :’)
I’ve heard this said in many customer calls :grimacing:
Is there a reason why it shouldnt be an open format?
It is as open as Microsoft word, or PDF
:slightly_smiling_face:
Microsoft Word is open
It’s OpenXML format :smile:
We can provide special libraries to deconstruct it
at the end of the day, this is simply protobufs layered over each other
Yeah basically what I am getting at is that we should have an open source library that basically has our protobufs
PDF is also an open spec

The openness and proprietariness of ibdoc (wrt future intention, not present actuality) is probably something that sales and PMs should be roped into since it’s essentially a feature of the platform sale

Also, there could be side-effects of converting to JSON and using it downstream. One of the main reasons we discourage “go in grab what you want” is to retain the freedom to change the internal structure of our output formats. We do not want customers to start relying on undocumented behavior, since that’s hard to track and change. Instead, we should understand what people need to reach in for and provide that as an external-facing module/API.
